physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a group of men pulling a small boat to shore. There are seven men in th epicture. Two of them are on the boat, three are seen pulling a rope attached to the boat, while two others on the right are loading items onto shore. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Jacky, Tich, Ginger, and Malaya boys, Singapore, 1941
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Soldiers Photography Boats and boating
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
